title: 106_hr1400
content: The Act titled "Bond Price Competition Improvement Act of 1999" extends transaction reporting to debt securities. The Bond Price Competition Improvement Act of 1999 extends transaction reporting to debt securities by amending subsection (d) of section 11A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. The amendment sets minimum requirements for transaction information on debt securities to ensure prompt, accurate, reliable, and fair collection, processing, distribution, and publication of transaction information. The Commission considers private sector systems for collecting transaction information on corporate debt securities. This subsection does not limit the Commission's authority under other provisions. Covered debt securities include bonds, debentures, or other debt instruments, excluding exempted securities. The Commission defines "transaction information" as details on price, volume, and yield of covered debt security transactions. Factors considered include market activity, liquidity, competition, investor protection, and public interest when creating rules for this subsection. The Securities and Exchange Commission must implement the requirements of section 11A(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 within 12 months of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 3. EXCHANGE LISTING OF DEBT SECURITIES. Amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to allow debt securities to be traded on an exchange without registration if the issuer already has registered securities on that exchange. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AMENDMENT. SEC. 4. TECHNICAL AMENDMENT. Amends the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 regarding exempted securities. The Comptroller General is required to conduct studies on improving the collection and dissemination of information on debt securities and municipal securities. The studies will be done in consultation with the Securities and Exchange Commission and the Municipal Securities Rulemaking Board. The Comptroller General will submit a report to Congress within one year of the enactment of the Act, identifying measures to enhance the collection, processing, and publication of information on debt securities and municipal securities. This includes recommendations for legislative or regulatory actions. The House of Representatives passed the bill on June 14, 1999.
